stories.title: Old (1994) List of IRC Servers – How many remain?

stories.text:
Wasn’t too sure how to phrase this one.

I have an old car (2003) and when I’m driving at night I’m always struck by how comforting and soft the light from the dashboard is (odometer, speedometer, revs, etc). Here’s an image for reference: https://ibb.co/wYXMxkY

Then I drive a more recent car - and the light, even on the dimmest setting has a more jarring quality.

How are these made? Are they just backlit panels with cutouts? I’d love to build a cli display using this kind of lighting.
stories.title: Ask HN: Night Friendly CLI Displays?

stories.text: I made this tool for learning vocabulary while reading. All the other alternatives I've seen are either proprietary, too difficult to set up, or lack features I need.
stories.title: Show HN: VocabSieve, a tool for vocabulary acquisition through text
Gluon: A static, type inferred and embeddable language written in Rust
Suburbia Is Subsidized: Here's the Math
U.S., U.K. investigating unusual cases of hepatitis in young children

stories.text:
Long story short, I was a stereotypical "good boy" in my youth and was very close with both of my parents. I started finding my own way in university and I've grown so much, but to them, I "changed". We barely talk anymore and there's tension all the time. Story for another time.

And for some reason, in real life I seem to be surrounded by peers with successful jobs and picture-perfect families.

So yeah, curious to know about you folks.
stories.title: Ask HN: How's your relationship with your parent(s)?
